Estonian Foreign Minister Margus TSAKHKNA stated that his country was going to sign a security agreement with Ukraine.

He is about itsaidAt a press conference in Vilnius after meeting the heads of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Baltic States, Ukraine and France.

"We are going to sign a bilateral agreement between Estonia and Ukraine for long -term military aid," said Margus Tsakhkn.

According to him, Estonia next week should approve a new military assistance package for Kiev.

The Minister reminded that Estonia has already invested 1.4% of GDP in Ukraine's military support and will continue to do so.

"After signing a bilateral agreement between Estonia and Ukraine, we promise and oblige to allocate 0.25% of GDP a year for military support," the Estonian Minister said.

He urged other Western countries to conclude the same obligation that Ukraine would count on 120 billion euros of military support for a year.

“Ukraine is fighting not only for its freedom, but for all of us. And as a country that borders the Russian Federation, we know very well that Russia is a threat and will remain a threat, ”said the Foreign Ministry of Estonia.
